ArticleTitle.sentence: Targeted disruption of the MyD88 gene results in loss of IL-1- and IL-18-mediated function.

event.clue: Targeted disruption of the MyD88 gene results in loss of IL-1- and IL-18-mediated function.

AbstractText.sentence: MyD88, originally isolated as a myeloid differentiation primary response gene, is shown to act as an adaptor in interleukin-1 (IL-1) signaling by interacting with both the IL-1 receptor complex and IL-1 receptor-associated kinase (IRAK).

event.clue: MyD88, originally isolated as a myeloid differentiation primary response gene, is shown to act as an adaptor in interleukin-1 (IL-1) signaling by interacting with both the IL-1 receptor complex and IL-1 receptor-associated kinase (IRAK).

AbstractText.sentence: Mice generated by gene targeting to lack MyD88 have defects in T cell proliferation as well as induction of acute phase proteins and cytokines in response to IL-1.

event.clue: Mice generated by gene targeting to lack MyD88 have defects in T cell proliferation as well as induction of acute phase proteins and cytokines in response to IL-1.

AbstractText.sentence: Increases in interferon-gamma production and natural killer cell activity in response to IL-18 are abrogated.

event.clue: Increases in interferon-gamma production and natural killer cell activity in response to IL-18 are abrogated.

AbstractText.sentence: In vivo Th1 response is also impaired.

event.clue: In vivo Th1 response is also impaired.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, IL-18-induced activation of NF-kappaB and c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) is blocked in MyD88-/- Th1-developing cells.

event.clue: Furthermore, IL-18-induced activation of NF-kappaB and c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) is blocked in MyD88-/- Th1-developing cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Taken together, these results demonstrate that MyD88 is a critical component in the signaling cascade that is mediated by IL-1 receptor as well as IL-18 receptor.
